Job Title: Senior Accounting Administrator - Full Time (1st Shift)

Location: Vineland, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Details:

If you are looking to make an impact in a meaningful way, join us at Tyson Foods where we are raising the worldâ€™s expectations for how much good food can do! We create quality products in a safe environment for our team members. We offer great benefits and steady work. This facility operates six days a week and produces Philly Style Beef and Chicken Steak.

Summary

The Senior Accounting Administrator is responsible for coordinating accounting functions and systems, and is the go-to person for specific financial reporting and related tasks supporting the Vineland Business Unit production facilities and Tyson Prepared Foods accounting departments. Responsibilities include:

Inventory reporting and managementYield preparation and analysisPayroll processingPreparing, distributing, and analyzing expense and operational reports and variancesMonitoring spends, and other related accounting administration items or special projects.Work closely with management in operations, packaging and labeling, quality assurance, plant accounting, and corporate accounting. 

Other duties include: This position will be responsible for compiling financial and statistical data while meeting reporting deadlines. Must have the ability to learn multiple aspects of manufacturing accounting such as basic elements of product costing, gather production and financial information to prepare weekly scorecards/reports, provide support to the physical inventory process, assist in conduction self-audit procedures. This position also needs to champion innovation and continuous improvement to transform the finance team, analytical tools, and reporting; and other duties as assigned duties by the Supervisor.

Requirements

Education: High School diploma or equivalentExperience: Must have a minimum of 2 years of experience in the financial/accounting/accounts payable/analytical administrative field or graduate of financial/accounting program.Computer Skills: Requires intermediate computer skills which should include the full suite of Microsoft Office products. Experience with SAP and computer-based inventory warehouse management systems is a plus.Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communications skills are essentialSpecial Skills: Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skillsMust be able to work overtime and/or weekends as neededMust be able to work effectively under time constraints

Relocation Assistance Eligible:

No

Work Shift: 

1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Hourly Applicants ONLY -You must complete the task after submitting your application to provide additional information to be considered for employment.

Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We provide our team members and their families with paid time off; 401(k) plans; affordable health, life, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits; and more.

CCPA Notice. If you are a California resident, and would like to learn more about what categories of personal information we collect when you apply for this job, and how we may use that information, please read our CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection, click here.

Experience Level (if available): None
